intro: Rauvolfia cubana, commonly known as Cuban snakeroot, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean, particularly Cuba and parts of Central America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its woody stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, white or pinkish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its roots contain alkaloids, which have been studied for potential medicinal properties. Rauvolfia cubana thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests.
